entity.description:
possible action items/usage:
- redfish root (see all bigger category features supported)
- more detail info for each supported resource

related uris:
- /redfish/v1
- /redfish/v1/$metadata
entity.name: 01_root

entity.description: more detailed info for each resource
entity.name: GET $metadata

entity.description: root link to all resources accessible by redfish
entity.name: GET redfish root

entity.description:
redfish session management

possible action items/usage:
- create a redfish session (X-Auth-Token for authorization)
- modify session timeout

related uris:
- /redfish/v1/SessionService
- /redfish/v1/SessionService/Sessions
entity.name: 02_session_service

entity.description: - array of all active redfish/web sessions
entity.name: GET session collection

entity.description: all things redfish session related
entity.name: GET session service

entity.description: modify body value to change session timeout (type int)
entity.name: PATCH session timeout

entity.description:
- modify body with an **existing** account's username and password to establish a session
- **save the X-Auth-Token in the headers in the response**
- X-Auth-Token can be used to replace credentials for future requests (given that the session is live)
entity.name: create a session

entity.description:
- uri destination is a sample only, actual destination depends on which session location was in the headers in Create a Session
- replace X-Auth-Token value in the header to the X-Auth-Token retrieved from Create a Session
entity.name: delete a session

entity.description:
ipmi (redfish + web) and snmp account management

possible action items/usage:
- check how many accounts + their privileges
- create an account
- delete an account
- modify an account (role, username, password, account type, other credentials (ex. SNMP))

related uris:
- /redfish/v1/AccountService
- /redfish/v1/AccountService/Accounts
- /redfish/v1/AccountService/Accounts/[num]
entity.name: 03_account_service

entity.description:
- add account: Redfish, SNMP, both
- modify account (username, password, account type)
- delete account
entity.name: account modification

entity.description: - location is **sample only**, actual location to make PATCH request is based on which account to modify
entity.name: change account type to SNMP + redfish

entity.description: - location is **sample only**, actual location to make PATCH request is based on which account to modify
entity.name: change account type to SNMP only

entity.description: - location is **sample only**, actual location to make PATCH request is based on which account to modify
entity.name: change account type to redfish only

entity.description:
- modify
    - UserName
    - Password
    - RoleId (Administrator, Operator, ReadOnly) : for Redfish only
    - SNMP.AuthenticationProtocol(HMAC_MD5 or HMAC_SHA96)
    - SNMP.AuthenticationKey (no special chars)
    - SNMP.EncryptionProtocol (CBC_DES or CFB128_AES128)
    - SNMP.EncryptionKey (no special chars)
entity.name: create SNNP and admin redfish account

entity.description: - change UserName and Password in body as desired
entity.name: create admin redfish account

entity.description: - modify UserName and Password values
entity.name: create operator redfish account

entity.description: - modify UserName and Password
entity.name: create readOnly redfish account

entity.description:
- modify
    - UserName
    - Password
    - SNMP.AuthenticationProtocol(HMAC_MD5 or HMAC_SHA96)
    - SNMP.AuthenticationKey (no special chars)
    - SNMP.EncryptionProtocol (CBC_DES or CFB128_AES128)
    - SNMP.EncryptionKey (no special chars)
entity.name: create snmp account

entity.description: - **sample location only**
entity.name: delete account

entity.description: - location is **sample only**, actual location to make PATCH request is based on which account to modify
entity.name: modify account password

entity.description: - location is **sample only**, actual location to make PATCH request is based on which account to modify
entity.name: modify account username

entity.description:
- enable and configure LDAP
- enable and configure Active Directory
entity.name: directory services (AD + LDAP)

entity.description: - template provided, all attributes are configurable, depending on AD server
entity.name: enable + configure AD

entity.description: - template provided, all attributes are configurable, depending on LDAP server
entity.name: enable + configure LDAP

entity.description: array of all accounts
entity.name: GET account collection

entity.description:
- get/set account settings
- get/set AD and LDAP settings
entity.name: GET account service

entity.description: default ADMIN account
entity.name: GET admin/default account

entity.description: - get all configurable account roles
entity.name: GET roles

entity.description:
- change value in body (type int)
- restriction: must be <= AccountLockoutDuration
- this value is the max amount of time between incorrect attempts that will be considered consecutive failed attempts (i.e. when the amount of time that has passed between a first incorrect attempt and a second incorrect attempt is > than this value, the second incorrect attempt will be considered "the first attempt" again towards the lockout threshold)
entity.name: configure account lockout counter reset after

entity.description:
- change value in body (type int)
- restriction: must be >= AccountLockoutCounterResetAfter
entity.name: configure account lockout duration

entity.description: - change value in body (type int)
entity.name: configure account lockout threshold

entity.description:
possible action items/usage:
- check thermal sensors
- check power/voltage sensors
- check fan sensors
- check storage info (controller + drives)
- turn on/off UID (chassis)
- turn on/off locator LED for drives (where supported)
- check PCIe devices (includes AOC NICs + GPUs)

entity.description:
configure various bmc settings

possible action items/usage:
- set date and time, NTP servers
- get BMC ip/network settings
- configure host interface
- perform bmc unit reset
- perform factory default
- check maintenance event log
- check mounted devices, mount/unmount virtual media
- configure and get IKVM link
- configure RADIUS, syslog
- configure ip access/filter rules
- configure fan mode, mouse mode
- configure smcrakp, kcs privilege
- license management
- enable system lockdown
- check POST code

related uris:
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Actions/Manager.Reset
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Actions/Oem/SmcManagerConfig.Reset
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/ResetActionInfo

- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/SerialInterfaces/[service_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1/Actions/LogService.ClearLog
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1/Entries 
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/LogServices/Log1/Entries/[log_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]          
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]/Actions/VirtualMedia.InsertMedia
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]/InsertMediaActionInfo
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/CD[mounted_dev_num]/Actions/VirtualMedia.EjectMedia
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/VirtualMedia/Floppy[mounted_dev_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/EthernetInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/EthernetInterfaces/[eth_num]
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/EthernetInterfaces/ToHost
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/HostInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/HostInterfaces/1
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/HostInterfaces/1/HostEthernetInterfaces
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/NetworkProtocol/HTTPS/Certificates/1

- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/NTP
- /redfish/v1/Managers/1/Oem/Supermicro/IKVM

entity.name: 05_managers

entity.description:
- enable/disable ip access control
- add/remove filter rules
- note can create two filter rules for the same address but different policy, but the one created first takes precedence
entity.name: IP access control

entity.description: - enable/disable the service here
entity.name: GET IP access control

entity.description: - array of all configured filter rules
entity.name: GET filter rules

entity.description: - value is type bool (true=enabled)
entity.name: configure IP access control

entity.description: - modify Address and PrefixLength as desired
entity.name: create accept filter rule

entity.description: - modify Address and PrefixLength as desired
entity.name: create drop filter rule

entity.description:
- **sample location**
- FilterRules/[num] depends on which filter to delete
entity.name: delete filter rule

entity.description:
- set NTP servers
- set DaylightSaving
- OEM (redfish standard is in NetworkProtocol), changes will be synced
entity.name: NTP

entity.description: - oem
entity.name: GET NTP configuration

entity.description: - value is type bool, modify as desired
entity.name: configure DaylightSavingTime

entity.description:
- modify the following as desired
    - NTPEnable: bool
    - PrimaryNTPServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
    - SecondaryNTPServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
entity.name: configure NTP

entity.description: - modify RADIUS configuration
entity.name: RADIUS configuration

entity.description:
- modify the following as desired
    - RadiusEnabled: bool
    - RadiusServer: ipv4/ipv6/domain name
    - RadiusPortNumber: int in valid port range
    - RadiusSecret: string
entity.name: configure RADIUS

entity.description:
- settings for SNMP commands to BMC
- note SNMPv3 accounts/usernames will be created in AccountService Accounts
entity.name: SNMP configuration

entity.description:
- settings for SNMP commands to BMC
- note SNMP accounts will be created in AccountService Accounts
entity.name: GET SNMP settings

entity.description:
- after PATCH will have 1 total community string
- modify CommunityString and Name as desired
entity.name: create 1 full access community string

entity.description:
- after PATCH will have 1 total community string
- modify CommunityString and Name as desired
entity.name: create 1 limited access community string

entity.description:
- sample payload will create 1 limited access community string, and 1 full access community string
- modify CommunityString and Name as desired
- max community strings supported = 5 (i.e. max 5 array elements)
entity.name: create multiple community strings

entity.description: - AuthenticationProtocol: Account and EncryptionProtocol: Account indicate Authentication/Encryption protocols should follow the ones defined in the SNMPv3 account
entity.name: enable SNMPv3

entity.description: - value of true will hide CommunityString in CommunityStrings (changed to null when GET again)
entity.name: hide community strings

entity.description: - value of false will expose CommunityString in CommunityStrings (i.e any account with access to NetworkProtocol will be able to see the exact community strings configured)
entity.name: show community strings

entity.description:
- bmc ip info (ipv4, ipv6 settings)
- service port : enable/disable, change port info
- host interface info

entity.description: - also linked from CertificateLocations
entity.name: GET detailed SSL cert info

entity.description: - array of links to bmc ip configuration + host interface

entity.description:
- services enabled
- which port used for each service
- ports:
    - HTTP/S
    - IPMI
    - SNMP
    - SSH
    - NTP
    - Virtual Media
    - KVMIP
    - SSDP
entity.name: GET network port info

entity.description:
- modify "SSH" to desired port
- Port = int within valid port range
- make sure port to change to is not already occupied/used

entity.description:
- modify the two array elements under NTPServers as desired
- note if NTP sync fails, NTP service will automatically disable

entity.description:
- modify "SSH" to desired port
- ProtocolEnabled = bool (true/false)
entity.name: enable/disable port

entity.description:
- modify KeyBitLength as desired (can remove)
    - 1024
    - 2048
    - 3072
    - 4096

entity.description: - generates a certificate signing request

entity.description:

- shows current mode

- POST code snooping

- enabled/disable syslog service

- modify the following as desired
    - EnableSyslog: bool

    - SyslogPortNumber: int, valid port range

entity.description:
- insert CD
- eject CD
- note currently cannot mount floppy via redfish, but will show link if mounted via web/ikvm
entity.name: virtual media

entity.description: - link will default exist
entity.name: GET CD in slot 1

entity.description:
- default shows one link to CD1
- more links will appear as more devices are mounted
- max 3 devices, only 0 or 1 floppy device total
- redfish + web "share" one slot (i.e. if mount CD via web, cannot mount via redfish and vice versa)
entity.name: GET Virtual Media

entity.description:
- location is **sample only** ("Floppy3"), Floppy[num] depends on where the floppy image is mounted
- currently cannot mount floppy via redfish, this link only appears if floppy already mounted via web/ikvm
entity.name: GET floppy

entity.description: - more help on insert media parameters
entity.name: GET mount image parameters

entity.description:
- CD[num] in location depends on what is already mounted
- modify Image, UserName, Password as desired
- UserName and Password are optional (i.e. only need if share host requires them)
entity.name: mount CD

entity.description:
- no payload
- only available when a CD is already mounted
entity.name: unmount CD

entity.description:
- links to various bmc configuration
- basic bmc config (ex. fw version, date/time)
- targets to perform bmc unit reset + factory default

entity.description: - template provided for format; modify values as desired

entity.description:
possible action items/usage:
- check/configure SEL + mark acknowledgements
- power control
- UID control
- configure BIOS (next boot, boot order, UEFI boot options, change boot mode)
- check processor info
- check DIMM info
- check storage info
- check NIC info
- configure NodeManager power policy (where applicable)

related uris:
- /redfish/v1/Systems/1
entity.name: 06_systems

entity.description:
- modify UEFI boot order
- disable UEFI boot option
- modify bios setting
- configure secureboot

entity.description: - make sure system is POST complete otherwise attributes will not appear
entity.name: GET current bios configuration

entity.description: - current secure boot configuration
entity.name: GET secure boot

entity.description: - array of links to each uefi boot option available (list should be same as /Systems/1 Boot.BootOrder)
entity.name: GET uefi boot options

entity.description:
- **sample payload only**
- actual BootOrder array value depends on current available options in Boot.BootOrder
- *requires host reboot to take effect*

entity.description: - *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: delete PK

entity.description: - *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: delete all secure boot keys

entity.description: - *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: disable secure boot

entity.description:
- **sample only**
- location depends on which boot options are available and which one to disable
- *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: disable uefi boot option

entity.description: - *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: enable secure boot

entity.description:
- **sample only**
- location depends on which boot options are available and which one to disable
- *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: enable uefi boot option

entity.description:
- any pending bios attribute changes will be shown here
- these are the changes that will take effect **after** a host reboot
entity.name: get pending settings

entity.description:
- **sample payload only**
- modify the attribute:value in Attributes as desired; reference Attributes list in /Bios response for proper attribute name
- after PATCH, settings will **not** take effect until after a complete host reboot
- check pending settings in /redfish/v1/Systems/1/Bios/SD
entity.name: modify bios setting

entity.description: - *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: reset all secure boot keys to default

entity.description:
- sample payload will set continuous boot override to bios setup menu
- modify BootSourceOverrideTarget as desired (available options are under BootSourceOverrideTarget@Redfish.AllowableValues)
- *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: set continuous boot override

entity.description:
- sample payload will set one-time boot override to bios setup menu
- modify BootSourceOverrideTarget as desired (available options are under BootSourceOverrideTarget@Redfish.AllowableValues)
- *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: set one time boot override

entity.description:
- **sample payload only**
- BootNext value depends on available options in Boot.BootOrder, and must be one the array values
- *requires host reboot to take effect*
entity.name: set one time boot to uefi boot option

entity.description:
- enable/disable AC power on event log
- enable/disable FIFO event log
- clear SEL
- acknowledge warning + critical entries
- clear acknowledgements

- true = use FIFO log

- true = allow verbose smart power logging

- note MarkAsAcknowledged only available for Warning or Critical level entries

entity.description:
subscriptions + SMTP configuration

possible action items/usage:
- configure subscriptions
- configure SMTP service

related uris:
- /redfish/v1/EventService
- /redfish/v1/EventService/Subscriptions
- /redfish/v1/EventService/Subscriptions/[num]
entity.name: 07_event_service

entity.description: - array of all configurable subscription slots (all default disabled)
entity.name: GET all subscriptions

entity.description:
- get/set SMTP configuration
- link to all subscriptions
entity.name: GET event service

entity.description: - details all possible and required/optional parameters for SubmitTestEvent action
entity.name: GET submit test event action info

entity.description:
- sample target, replace 1 in target location with the # subscription as desired
    - for example if want to check third subscription, change GET location to /redfish/v1/EventService/Subscriptions/3
entity.name: GET subscription

entity.description:
- sample location only, modify to desired subscription
- will restore subscription configuration to default
entity.name: clear subscription configuration

entity.description:
- **sample payload only**
- modify all values as desired
- OPTIONAL (only include as needed):
    - FromAddress (only if desired)
    - ConnectionProtocol
    - Authentication
    - Username (if authentication needed)
    - Password (if authentciation needed)
entity.name: configure SMTP

entity.description:
- sample location only (will depend on which subscription to configure)
- modify the following as desired
    - Destination: keep http/s + port
    - Context: string to provide context in event
    - EventTypes
- EventTypes is an array type that can contain one or up to all of the following
    - Alert
    - ResourceAdded
    - ResourceRemoved
    - ResourceUpdated
    - StatusChange
entity.name: configure redfish subscription

entity.description:
- sample location only (will depend on which subscription to configure)
- modify the following as desired
    - Destination: target email address
    - Context: string to provide context in event
    - SMTPSubject: string for subject line
    - Severity: Information / Warning / Critical
    - EventTypes
- EventTypes is an array type that can contain one or up to all of the following
    - Alert
    - ResourceAdded
    - ResourceRemoved
    - ResourceUpdated
    - StatusChange
entity.name: configure smtp subscription

entity.description:
- sample location only (will depend on which subscription to configure)
- modify the following as desired
    - Destination: snmp receiver
    - TrapCommunity: string
    - Severity: Information / Warning / Critical
entity.name: configure snmpv1 subscription

entity.description:
- sample location only (will depend on which subscription to configure)
- modify the following as desired
    - Destination: snmp receiver
    - AuthenticationProtocol: HMAC_MD5 / HMAC_SHA96
    - EncryptionProtocol: CBC_DES / CFB128_AES128
    - AuthenticationKey: string
    - EncyrptionKey: string
    - Severity: Information / Warning / Critical
entity.name: configure snmpv3 subscription

entity.description:
- mainly to test subscriptions
- will send an event to all enabled subscriptions
- only required attribute in payload is MessageId
- specific parameter details check action info
entity.name: send test event

- BackupBIOS is only applicable to RoT platforms

- BackupBIOS is only applicable to RoT platforms

- BackupBMC is only applicable to RoT platforms

    - PreserveSdr: SDR info
    - PreserveSsl: SSL certificate
- BackupBMC is only applicable to RoT platforms

- this action will **NOT** update FW until a separate request to Start Update is sent
- BackupBMC is only applicable to RoT platforms
entity.name: bmc: upload fw for update no preserve no backup

- does not work with immediate updates
